data.title: Begums Fortune by Jules Verne, First Edition
data.meta_description: BEGUM'S FORTUNE (Fitzroy Edition) by VERNE, JULES and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Rebound. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Translated by W. H. G. Kingston, Sampson Low, Marston, Searle, & Rivington, London, not dated c. 1890. , iv+239+(1) illustrated f,rontispiece five full page black and white illustr. . 2 pages list of books by Jules Verne at end with choice of four binding options/ prices. All of our books are in the shop, and are 'real' books. We try to post the same day as the order. Descriptions are conservative. Postage rates may be lower than ABE estimate, please use Ask Bookseller a Question to confirm availability and postage cost, use [Ask Bookseller a Question] option below to confirm availability and get accurate postage quote for this item (the amount quoted is for an 'average' hard-cover book of up to 1kg in weight).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Frontispiece (illustrator). First Edition Thus. First Edition thus. Original cloth, slight offsetting to endpapers from jacket flaps, small neat ownership stamp on ffe. near fine. In near fine dust jacket with the original price intact on the front flap. Illustrated frontispiece. The Fitzroy Edition. Just out of 50 year storage. Very scarce in this nice condition.

Pictorial Cover. Condition: Very Good ++. No Jacket. New Edition. New Edition 1883 44 Illustrations. Include the story The Mutineers on the Bounty. The book is very good+ and is in bright condition. Lovely pictorial boards. Contents good with gift school plate to endpaper. Endpapers cracked/repaired at hinges. Nice tight textblock. More images can be taken upon request. Ref 4619 ####008075 Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall.

[Science Fiction] FIRST UK EDITION. Octavo (19 x 15cm), pp.viii; 272. With numerous illustrations. Publisher's green cloth with gilt titles and black decoration to spine and upper, all edges gilt. A well-used copy with joints rubbed/worn, re-cased without half-title and frontis, replacement endpapers (circa 1932, with dated ink name). Good only. An inexpensive copy of the first British edition. When a huge inheritance of over 500 million Franks is divided in two, the heirs build two very different private cities â" one a peaceful utopian society; the other a war machine devoted to the other's destruction. Provenance; H.A.V. Bulleid, M.A. (1912-2009) writer, film-maker and cinema historian, and an amateur bibliographer of Jules Verne.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Plates throughout. (illustrator). 1st Edition. First U. K. edition, 1880. The publishers catalogue at the end of the book is dated October, 1879. Plates throughout. All edges gilt. Some very light foxing in places. Publishers gilt and black decorated green cloth is very slightly darkened, some very light rubbing to the edges and a very small mark to rear cover. Generally a very good solid copy. The book is collated complete. Unusually good copy and scarce as such. 272 p. Book.
